thought: The status code 200 indicates that the website is accessible. However, this does not provide information on its legitimacy. I will now extract the text from the website to look for any signs of the scam characteristics listed.
observation: RIT Capital Partners plc |  Skip to main content Search form Search Home About us Investment approach Our Board Our Investment Manager (JRCM) Our history Buy RIT Shares Shareholder information RIT in the news Reports Financial performance Factsheets Detailed share price Historical performance Regulatory disclosures Annual General Meeting Company announcements Regulatory announcements Financial calendar Email alerts Contact us Delivering exceptional long-term performance £10,000 invested in RIT at inception would be worth ~£351,000¹ today² compared to the same amount invested in the ACWI³ which would be worth ~£123,000. Latest News: RIT publishes March NAV and commentary RIT Capital Partners plc is an investment trust whose objective is to deliver long-term capital growth, while preserving shareholders’ capital. Since listing on the London Stock Exchange in 1988, we have generated a share price total return of 10.6% per annum for our shareholders. Read more > RIT: Investing in RIT is easy with a UK online stockbroker such as Hargreaves Lansdown. Click here to buy RIT shares now RIT shares are also appropriate for IFAs to market to their retail investors Our reports Annual Report December 2023 Half Yearly Report to June 2023 Our manager, J. Rothschild Capital Management Limited (JRCM), combines investment expertise with access to high quality deal flow.  The essence of JRCM’s investment approach is to combine capital preservation with capital growth over the long term. Since 1988, RIT has delivered outstanding performance for its shareholders. Over the last ten years, a RIT shareholder has seen a NAV per share total return of 109%¹. A shareholder who invested in RIT at inception will have seen a share price total return of 10.6% per annum. Find out more Based in historic Spencer House, RIT traces its origins back to 1971 when Jacob Rothschild was appointed chairman of a £5 million Investment Trust. Today RIT has net assets of over £3.5 billion². ¹ With dividends reinvested. The RIT Capital Partners plc website is for information purposes only and nothing contained in this website constitutes investment advice.  Past performance is not necessarily a guide to future returns.  The value of investments can fall or rise and you may not get back the amount invested. Alert: Imposter websites InvestorRelations@ritcap.co.uk Terms of Use Privacy Policy Modern Slavery Statement Accessibility FAQs Sitemap Cookies Disclaimer Moore Wilson

thought: The text extracted from the website does not immediately suggest any of the scam characteristics. It mentions RIT Capital Partners plc, an investment trust, and provides details about its historical performance and investment approach. It appears to be targeting professional or semi-professional investors rather than exhibiting unusually low prices or claims of free products. It also includes regulatory disclosures and contact information. However, to be thorough, I should check the legitimacy of the company and the website's ownership.

The domain has been registered since 2005 and is set to expire in 2024, which suggests a long-standing presence on the internet. The use of a privacy service to redact personal information is common and does not necessarily indicate a scam. thought: The search results indicate that RIT Capital Partners plc is an existing company with a history and presence in the financial industry. It is listed on the London Stock Exchange and has been mentioned in various financial news articles and platforms, such as Trustnet, Morningstar, and the Financial Times. This provides evidence that it is a legitimate company with public financial activities, and the website's content aligns with the kind of information one would expect from such a company. Given the legitimacy of the company and the absence of any direct scam indicators from the website's content or the WHOIS data, there is no current reason to believe the website is a scam. I now know the final answer. Based on the available evidence, the website https://www.ritcap.com/ does not appear to be a scam website.
